paragraphs.text: I agree that we should not identify ourselves with our thoughts, because they are the representations of our habits and beliefs of the past experiences. Though taking discomfort is not just do something what is different, but starting by self-awareness — why I’m thinking the way I’m thinking, and why I’m reacting in this particular way. Bringing the…

paragraphs.text: Great article.One of my mentors used to tell me that if you want to do something which you do not want to do,do not read or talk to people who have failed in doing so earlier.This way you approach the work without any preconceived notion and the chances of success increase drastically.

paragraphs.text: That’s a great question, Iva, and I’d imagine it would vary a lot from person to person. If you’re prone to burnout, you obviously have to be more careful when pushing yourself. If not, I think you’ll be fine as long as you master your fundamentals: http://www.selfication.com/peak-performance/improve-your-life/ I hope this helps! :)
